member.summary: Specifies how the functions.

member.summary: No modes are enabled.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.AnalysisModes.AutomaticReconciliationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the automatically starts the reconciliation operation as soon as the intermediate or final results are ready. If this mode is enabled, the event is not raised. If this mode is disabled, the event is raised.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.AnalysisModes.StrokeCacheAutoCleanupEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the automatically clears unneeded strokes from the stroke cache before performing analysis. If this mode is enabled, the clears the stroke data before performing analysis. Your code must also then handle the event. If the event is not handled, an exception is raised. This check is done both at the Analyze (or BackgroundAnalyze) and Reconciliation phases. If this mode is disabled, the does not clear the stroke data. To clear the stroke data, call . If this mode is disabled, the event is raised so the can retrieve the latest stroke data for any strokes that have had their cache cleared. If the stroke cache is cleared, but the event is not handled, an exception is raised.

member.summary: Indicates that personalization is enabled.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.AnalysisModes.Default
member.summary: All modes are enabled.

member.summary: Supports free input, where ink is entered without the use of a recognition guide, such as a line or a box.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.LinedInput
member.summary: Supports lined input, which is similar to writing on lined paper.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.BoxedInput
member.summary: Supports boxed input, where each character or word is entered in a box.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.CharacterAutoCompletionInput
member.summary: Supports character Autocomplete. Recognizers that support character Autocomplete require boxed input.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.RightAndDown
member.summary: Supports handwriting input in right and down order, such as in western languages and some East Asian languages.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.LeftAndDown
member.summary: Supports handwriting input in left and down order, such as in Hebrew and Arabic languages.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.DownAndLeft
member.summary: Supports handwriting input in down and left order, such as in some East Asian languages.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.DownAndRight
member.summary: Supports handwriting input in down and right order, such as in some East Asian languages.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.ArbitraryAngle
member.summary: Supports text written at arbitrary angles.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.Lattice
member.summary: Supports returning a object as an alternative to for handwriting recognition results.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.AdviseInkChange
member.summary: Supports interrupting background recognition, such as when the ink has changed.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.StrokeReorder
member.summary: Supports that stroke order—spatial and temporal—is handled as part of the recognition operation. The does not reorder strokes before sending ink to the .

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.Personalizable
member.summary: Supports personalized handwriting, where the recognizer improves recognition when exposed to the same handwriting over time.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.PrefersArbitraryAngle
member.summary: Supports an option available under the - of not rotating handwriting to a horizontal orientation before sending the ink to the .

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.PrefersParagraphBreaking
member.summary: Indicates that the should send entire paragraphs of ink to the InkRecognizerBase, allowing the InkRecognizerBase instances to do the line breaking and word (or character) breaking.

member.name: F:System.Windows.Ink.AnalysisCore.InkRecognizerCapabilities.PrefersSegmentationRecognition
member.summary: Recognizes only one word or character per recognition operation. The performs segmentation on the handwriting and sends only one segment at a time to the .
